ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.

options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: How to be a scientist, how to conduct research, analyze and present data, as well as become a lifelong science learner.
Ability to perform own research, write about science comprehensively, and present
I learned more about how to conduct an independent research project and gained valuable skills on understanding and evaluating results.
New information regarding my thesis project
I gained an incredible amount of insight into data visualization projects dealing with large amounts of stochastic computational data.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Great class to sum up 4 years in the major.
I had a good experience; we could definitely meet more often.
Perhaps some of the midterm deadlines could be more involved in order to encourage students to really keep up with their thesis from the get go.
We could have more check-ins throughout the semester with the leaders of the course

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. comments: n/a
N/A
This worked well for me as my research was all computer-based and could be done remotely.
I thought they all were good!
I appreciated my research could be conducted virtually given my remote status during the pandemic.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.

comments: Yes, to all BME majors.

Yes, if in BME major

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: n/a
remote analysis
Basically research for credit -- no actual meeting, but there were project proposals at the beginning, a midterm report, and a final report due.
Remote work with virtual one-on-one advising.
weekly meetings with mentor
I met with my lab advisor and lab head in weekly live virtual meetings and discussions.
